conclusion: Analyze forces and equilibrium conditions to solve for force F.
Ball on a smooth ring with a rope through a hole at the highest point.
Identify forces: gravitational force, tension in the rope, normal reaction.
Gravitational force (weight) is mg acting downward.
Tension in the rope is T acting along the rope.
Normal reaction from the ring is N acting perpendicular to the surface.
Net force in radial and tangential directions must be zero for equilibrium.
Radial direction forces: component of gravitational force mg cos θ and normal reaction N.
Tangential direction forces: component of gravitational force mg sin θ and tension T.
Force F is exerted by the upper end of the rope pulling through the hole.
Tension T in the rope is equal to force F.
Substitute T = mg sin θ to find F.
F is the component of gravitational force acting tangentially along the rope.
